review_blob: Pours a hazy pale orange with a big frothy off-white head. Aroma has strong notes of mango and citric hops on a very malty body. The taste is amazingly complex - sweet mango-peach rapidly turning intensely bitter. The finish is lingering bitterness. The taste of the beer makes the mouth water making the beer less dry than I would like but I suppose that this is a testament to the beers flavor. Excellent.

Pours an inky black with almost no head. Lovely aroma of vanilla, coffee, toffee and cocoa. The taste is complex, featuring hops, carmel, coffee, malts, chocolate and vanilla all blending together exceedingly well. The palate is thinner than I would have liked but is exceedingly smooth and mild given the high alcohol content.
beer_name: Dock Street Barrel Aged Prince Myshkins

review_blob: Pours a deep brown with a very thin brown creamy head. The aroma is delicious and strong with plenty of chocolate and malt. Chocolate and hops dominate the taste and are just right. The body is a bit too thin and non alcoholic though.
Strong hoppy notes in this one with a subdued malty character. Very warming!
Pours a deep cherry red with a sweet aroma of tart cherries, plums, dates and apricots. The taste is of sweet cherry-liquorice followed by a smooth full-bodied malty finish.

This beer is served in an attractive snifter with a small but thick creamy-brown head. The aroma has strong malty notes with hints of cherry and apricots. The flavor has complex malty notes with figs and nuts. The mouth-feel is amazing - full bodied and warm.
beer_name: Dock Street Prince Myshkins Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob: Pours a cloudy yellow-orange with almost no head. Syrupy thick body. Fruity aroma with some hops, malt and candy. Hoppy bitter taste giving way to an amazingly flavorful sharp fruity taste. Sweet malty and spicy notes. Absolutely amazing. Warm thick body with a great lingering taste, makes my mouth water.
Pours a hazy cherry red with a small white head that quickly subsides. Sweet, overpowering strawberry aroma. Sweet strawberry taste on a light lively body.,

Pours a clear deep cherry reddish-brown with a large foamy cream colored head. Strong malty notes in the nose with toffee and candy. Lively malty body with a good dose of hoppy bitterness followed by some toffee. Thin finish, but warming.

Small, almost non-existant head. Sweet malty aroma with lots of clove and pumpkin. Pale yellow orange body. Watery body with lots of sweetness, some pumpkin flavor and some spice. Mild hoppy aftertaste. Heavy carbonation. Too thin to be good.
beer_name: Buffalo Bills Americas Original Pumpkin Ale

review_blob: Clear hoppy aroma on a white head. Golden yellow body. Strong hoppy aroma with a sweet aftertaste that quickly turns bitter. Malty lingering body. The best lager Ive had so far. Makes we wanna go get some good solid foodand drink more.

Pours a nice wheatish orange with a large rocky white head that rapidly disappates. Good lacing. Tangy hoppy aroma with some fruity notes. Sweet banana taste with some mild bitterness on a nice full body.
Pours slightly hazy with a lively orange color. Strong peach aroma. Lively peach taste on a sparkling body.
Pours a light hazy yellow orange with a large frothy white head. Malty aroma, not much else there. Thin malty taste on a light body. Not very good.

Pours a deep tawny orange with a frothy medium sized head. The body is a tad too dark for an IPA though. Pleasently strong aroma of citric fruits with cantelop melons prominent. Hoppy flavor with nice bitter notes on a malt base. Unfortunately, the hops have no character, just bitterness. The body is a tad too thick and should have been stronger. On continued coinsumption, one thing is apparent, the flavors vanish!

Pours a deep brownish-black with large frothy brown head with lots of coffee and nuts in a malty nose. Rich malty taste with coffee, nuts molasses and hints of candy and chocolate on a bitter thick creamy body. Good stuff!

Gelatinous dark brown pour with a edium tan head that rapidly vanishes I know the use of the word gelatinous doesnt sound very flattering, but it actually looked very appealing. Strong sweet malty aroma with notes of brown sugar, candy, molasses, raisins, nuts and mild hops. Rich malty taste with a sweet opening followed by a delicious blend of hops. The body is syrup like in consistancy with a powerful alcohol burn.

Pours a hazy deep golden orange with a creamy off-white medium head that leaves a lot of lacing behind. Strong sweet hoppy aroma with orange, grapefruit and perhaps canteloup melons. Very appealing. Strong bitter hoppy taste with a thin clear bitter body. Noticable warming effect. This is great stuff, but in making it an imperial IPA, theye lost the citrusy flavour of the standard GF IPA. Its still very very good.

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Pours a hazy golden orange with a small lively head. Light malty aroma with some woody hops on the nose. Bitter hoppy taste with light notes of grapefruit. Clear bitter ending. A good IPA, but not outstanding in any way. Probably a good way to introduce someone to IPAs.

Amber orange, large white creamy head that leaves a thick lacing. Overpoweringly malty aroma, though the hops do come through nicely. Some notes of caramel. Nice thick bitter taste with lots of citrus hops and amazingly enough, some lovely necter sweetness. The body is initially very smooth and slick with a nice heavy feel. A good alcohol burn kicks in towards the end.
beer_name: Flying Dog Double Dog Double Pale Ale

review_blob: Pours a light golden orange with a medium white lively head. Sweet malty head with some honey and mild fruits. Thin watery taste with a mild malty flavor. The flavor does have some nice honey notes towards the end, but the weak wateryness ruins the beer. Not much raspberry there either. Not much body to speak of.

Pours an amber orange with a large frothy head that quickly subsides leaving behind some nice lacing. Lots of malt and molasses in the aroma with some woody hops. Not much wheat or cherry. Weak malty taste with some hops. Cherry notes kicking in at the end, alternating with mild tannin flavors. Smooth malty body with some tart cherry flavor.

Pours a beautiful hazy ruby red with a delicate pink head. Very unusual and promising looks. Strong aroma of raspberries with mild medicinal notes. Strong raspberry taste with lots of acidity ending with raspberries again, almost as though theyre in there, crushed. If it was a painting, Id describe it as vivid. Tart ending on a thin body. Great beer for certain occasions - say a countryside picnic, but not quite something Id fancy all the time.

Strongly areated, spilled over on opening. Gingery aroma with a nice yeasty nose. Hazy orange brown body with a large creamy head that rapidly vanishes. Ginger bite in the first sip with a nice spicy flavor on a malty body.  Yeasty body, slightly thin. Not bad.
Pours golden yellow with a lively body and a small head. Good aroma of pears and a nice body.

Strong coffee aroma with lots of toffee and candy. Pours deep reddish brown, almost black with a small amount of head. Strong coffee flavor with nuts, candy. Some sour notes and tannin. Thin body (for a stout) with a pleasent bittery aftertaste and a slight alcohol warming sensation.
Thin malty aroma. Drk amber body. Malty taste with some corn and hops. Thin watery body.
UPDATED: JUN 6, 2007

Deep rich roasted aroma with lots of roasted malts with some molasses. Reddish brown color with a thin head that leaves an interesting pattern on the glass. Excellent sweet molasses taste with lots of gum, nuts and candy on a deiciously thick and lingering body with just a hint of alcohol burn.
Sweet malty aroma with woody notes.Light brown in color with a small but persistant white head. Nutty malty flavor on a thick body.

Pours a deep dark brown with a medium tan head.The head looks creamy and frothy. Lovely roasted malt aroma with a hint of tartness. Sweet flavor with alternating notes of a lovely cherry tartness and roasted malts. The cherry taste lingers on longer. Thick creamy body with no alcohol burn. Very smooth and leaves an excellent tart cherry taste behind. A truly marvelous beer!

Pours a nice deep reddish brown with a pale yellow-brown head that subsides quickly. Chocolaty aroma with perhaps nuts. Deep mouthfeel with nuts, caramel, cheese and not the slightest taste of the alcohol in either the palate or the finish other than a gentle warming like a cool autumn evening.
UPDATED: APR 7, 2007
UPDATED: MAR 24, 2007
Swill, piss, drain water. Wouldnt drink it unless paid a lot to do so, then Id throw up.
UPDATED: MAY 26, 2007
Pours a pale yellow with a thick strong head. Grassy aroma with the typical larger scent. Strong but tasteless. Thin, metallic body.
Faint aroma of corn with light hoppy notes on a very thin, sickly pale body. Almost no taste. What little taste there was was mostly grassy. Thin thin body.
UPDATED: MAR 24, 2007

beer_brewer_name: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review_blob: Pours a cloudy woody brownwith a thin creamy white head. Lively looking body. Strong yeasty aroma of bananas, cloves and nutmeg. Bready notes. Lively thin taste with an unexpectedly thick end. Lively aftertaste.

Pours a a deep brown, almost black with a thin muddy brown head. Strong aroma of coffee, chocolate, currents, plums, dates, black cherry and some sort of liquor. Strong  taste of chocolate, coffee, liquor, cherries, dates, and plums on a great warming body. First thing I thought of when I sipped this was to buy two or three more for keeping.

Pours a light orange tan with a medium pale orange head. Strong, delecious aroma of citric, pine and floral hops with a hint of maybe mango underneath. Strong bitter hoppy taste with a great tang and lots of fruityness. Dry strong bitter body - perfect.
beer_name: Avery The Maharaja Imperial India Pale Ale

review_blob: Pours a clear dark red-brown with a large pale yellow-brown head. Strong aroma of malts, fruit, butterscotch, caramel, and nuts. Some hops too. Strong hoppy bitter taste with a lovely alcohol burn. Sweet, sugary aftertaste with a very nice smooth finish. The body could be thicker and less agressive on the hops, but otherwise perfect.
Pours a hazy reddish amber with an almost non-existant yellow-brown head. Strong malty aroma with lots of floral hops. Sweet bitter taste - initially malty with a good hoppy bite. Medium thick body.

beer_brewer_name: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review_blob: Pours cloudy brown with substantial foam/sediment. Malty yeast smell with hints of banana and brown sugar. Strong molasses flavor with a powerful finish, alcohol flavor. Lively, alcohol burn, lasting flavor.
Clear dark copper amber. Very small whiteish head. Strong smell of burnt oranges with lots ofhops. Strong hoppy taste on a malty thin body

Dark brown pour with a thick brownish head. Prunes, currents, raisens, dates, molassess and cherries in the nose. Smooth medium thick body with a lively ending. Hops at the end of a malty start. Fruity notes.Some spice too. Lots of alcohol in the end.
Pours a cloudy dark reddish amber color.  Strong malty notes with fruity apricot smell. Mildly hoppy notes on a sharp tasing body.Thin body.
beer_name: Bear Republic Hop Rod Rye Ale

review_blob: Pours with no head on a dull golden-yelow body. Strong medicinal aroma with lots of honey underneath. Strong sweet honey flavor with lots of alcohol. Medium thick body.

Pours with a small thin white head on a cloudy amber body. Light malty with some citric notes and spices and yeast. Lively spicy taste with a good bite. The alcohol is fairly pronounced but the sweetness of the body keeps the alcohol taste tolerable. Medium thick body.
beer_name: Dogfish Head Midas Touch Golden Elixir
